batch

Class BatchConsole

  • java.lang.Object
    • batch.BatchExecutor
      • batch.BatchConsole
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<MediaFile>

    public final class BatchConsole
extends BatchExecutor

    This is the main console batch executor used for copying media files and updating metadata. Command line arguments are read and processed, aiming to write copied files to a target directory and sorting them by their Date Taken metadata attribute.

    Specifically, it updates each file's creation date, last modification time, and last access time to align with the corresponding Date Taken property. The sorted list can be either in an ascending (default) or descending chronological order.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Constructor Detail

      • BatchConsole

        public BatchConsole(BatchBuilder builder)
             throws BatchErrorException
        Constructs a console interface, using a Builder design pattern to process the parameters and update the copied image files. The actual Builder implementation exists in the BatchBuilder class.
        Parameters:
        builder - the Builder object containing parameters for constructing this instance
        Throws:
        BatchErrorException - if any metadata-related reading error occurs

    • Method Detail

      • processBatchCopy

        public void processBatchCopy()
        Executes the batch copying process, iterating through the internal sorted set of MediaFile objects and copies each source file to the target directory. It renames the copied file using the specified prefix and updates its file time attributes (creation, last modified, and last access) to match the Date Taken timestamp determined during the scan phase.
        Overrides:
        processBatchCopy in class BatchExecutor

      • scanArguments

        private static common.cli.CommandLineReader scanArguments(java.lang.String[] arguments)
        Configures and parses the supported command-line arguments.

        This method defines the rules for known flags and options. Note that most option handling logic is delegated to the surrounding Builder-pattern implementation, while this method primarily registers the supported flags.

        Parameters:
        arguments - the raw command-line arguments passed to main
        Returns:
        a CommandLineReader instance, already configured and parsed for the current invocation
